intro: Dimeria trimenii, commonly known as the Madagascar dimeria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in its arid native habitat. It is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in full sun. Dimeria trimenii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
